item.title: Spaghetti
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: A woman bowed down Before her plate of spaghetti To send God a prayer He's heard a thousand times already. But Jesus was in such A mischievous mood That He let the woman hear What the Father thought of her food. "There she goes again With her cookie-cutter request Full of empty words meant To ensure her noodles are blessed." But the woman quickly answered, "There's no need to be so rude!

item.title: Congenealogy
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: I can tell by your withering leaves And dwindling fruits, Your outstretched branch Has lost touch with its roots. You have overextended To give wind its due chase, But the rush that you seek Will destroy you posthaste.

item.title: Sculptor
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: I'm sick of the secrets I keep tucked away Within my liver and lungs At the end of each day. Soon my body Will begin to talk back. Songs full of secrets Will spill from the cracks. My apologies. I fear I'm just as hollow as well. I sing doxologies, But I'll appear To follow all hell Once my liver and lungs Begin to talk back Once they're sick Of the secrets Spilling from the cracks For I knew Smoke and water Will take the form Of its vessel But little did I know Both will leak When I wrestle My Sculptor.
